image.altText: Two middle-aged women walk up the stairs of the NT Supreme Court in Darwin

props.synopsis: A mother and son duo who tried to cover-up the hit-and-run death of an Aboriginal woman by moving and burying most of her body in Darwin's rural area have been sentenced in the NT Supreme Court. The victim's leg was found on the side of the Stuart Highway last year.

title.children: Mother and son jailed for attempting to hide Indigenous woman's body following fatal hit-and-run

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the financial disclosures of sustainable or ethical-labelled super options finds extensive investment in shares of companies in the fossil fuel, gambling, alcohol and weapons manufacturing industries.

title.children: How $1 billion of ethical retirement savings ended up with oil, gas and coal companies

image.altText: Man wearing traditional Emirati clothing walks past a big saying which reads #COP28

props.synopsis: The key takeaways from the summit are a transition away from fossil fuels, a tripling of renewable energy and committing to stop adding carbon dioxide to the atmosphere by mid-century.

title.children: COP28 summit wraps up with fossil fuels and renewable energy at forefront of global leaders' minds

image.altText: Person reads a funeral booklet with pictures on both pages

props.synopsis: On what would have been his 77th birthday, hundreds of family and friends hear glowing tributes to Tom Pauling AO KC, at a state funeral in Darwin.

title.children: Former administrator and solicitor-general remembered as a 'true NT legend' at state funeral

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

props.synopsis: Experts say it's easier than you think for cybercriminals to guess your credit card details. And it's costing customers and small businesses.

title.children: John's travel card had never left his wallet. Scammers still found a way into his account

image.altText: Mono Go Head 1

props.synopsis: Monopoly Go has earnt more than $1 billion in revenue since release but a recent promotion referencing a Dreamtime story has been slammed for a lack of consultation with First Nations people.

title.children: 'Did you even stop to consult anyone Aboriginal?': US game studio faces questions over use of Indigenous culture

image.altText: A generic image of an engineered stone kitchen bench in a modern kitchen.

props.synopsis: This week, Australia became the first country in the world to announce a ban on engineered stone. We look at why it's being banned, what alternatives there are, and what it could mean for your next home renovation.

title.children: Engineered stone has been banned due to the silicosis risk. What happens next?

image.altText: A young white woman with long dark hair sitting on a couch with a beagle

props.synopsis: Facilities and services providing cosmetic surgery will be forced to comply with new national standards released today as part of a suite of crackdowns on the industry by regulators.

title.children: New rules released as part of crackdown on 'Wild West' cosmetic surgery industry

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Katy Gallagher talk while walking in a parliament house corridor

props.synopsis: Economists say luck is offering Labor plenty of good economic fortunes. Treasurer Jim Chalmers doesn't see it that way but won't be complaining if it continues.

title.children: Chalmers's surplus victory lap doesn't mean much for cost-of-living relief, yet

props.synopsis: Once labelled Australia's worst female serial killer due to the death of her four children, Kathleen Folbigg is expected to learn today whether her convictions will be overturned by the Court of Criminal Appeal.

title.children: Court expected to decide whether to overturn Kathleen Folbigg's convictions

image.altText: A group of men and women dressed in medieval outfits holding large bows and arrows

props.synopsis: The Middle Ages have a very bad reputation. Here's what this period of history was really like.

title.children: Dragons aside, were the Middle Ages really like Game of Thrones?

image.altText: Older man wearing a blue and grey checkered shirt standing on a farm.

props.synopsis: Arnold Dix was in Europe when he received a call about the tunnel's collapse from India's chief engineer. He was instrumental in getting all of the trapped workers out alive.

title.children: Meet the 'nerdy' Aussie farmer behind the Indian tunnel rescue that saved 41 people

image.altText: shelves of food with the products smashed on the ground.

props.synopsis: After their business in a small town was broken into for the second time, Josh and Samantha feel defenceless to criminals. There are growing concerns about the low police presence in small communities and calls for the state government to intervene.

title.children: 'We have a very, very thin blue line' : Calls to boost police numbers in Victorian towns

image.altText: An Airnorth Embraer 170 jet.

props.synopsis: The airline will launch the thrice-weekly flights next year, becoming the third to announce an expansion to its network in the Northern Territory in recent months.

title.children: Regional airline Airnorth to expand service in NT with new Perth-Alice Springs flights

image.altText: A man and woman pictured from security cameras walking along Hosier Lane.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne schoolgirl says she is afraid to go out in public after a man allegedly attempted to abduct her during a school excursion last month.

title.children: 'Nothing short of heroic': Praise for bystander who stopped alleged abduction attempt in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: A woman in a long coat, beanie, gloves, holding a dog, crying, next to a damaged building and burned car.

props.synopsis: Falling debris causes injuries and destruction in four of Kyiv's districts along the Dnipro River, with 18 people reportedly hospitalised.

title.children: Children among 53 injured as Russian missiles hit Kyiv apartments and children's hospital

image.altText: A woman wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has fast-tracked a development in Appin, south-west of Sydney, that it says will help address the state's housing crisis. But local residents fear they will be left stranded without infrastructure.

title.children: This little town is being rezoned to grow 13 times bigger but there's still no infrastructure plan

image.altText: Large wave.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper has made landfall, bringing large swells, storms and the risk of life-threatening flash flooding.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper crosses the coast north of Cairns

image.altText: A back view of a modern flood light at a sports stadium on a dark night.

props.synopsis: Queensland's incoming premier vows to review the $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild and promises "fresh faces" in a new-look cabinet once he is confirmed.

title.children: $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild in doubt as incoming premier signals major Olympic project review

image.altText: A surfer walking out of the ocean carrying a surfboard.

props.synopsis: A one-punch attacker's barrister tells a NSW court he was "triggered" by seeing the victim, who was a convicted child sex offender, with a young woman before the fatal assault.

title.children: Court hears man who killed former pro-surfer Chris Davidson wanted to protect children

image.altText: a young man with short hair sits on a couch while patting his black and white, mixed-breed dog

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Keith Kerinauia, the man accused of murdering 20-year-old Declan Laverty in Darwin earlier this year, are expected to argue their client acted in self-defence before allegedly stabbing the bottle shop worker.

title.children: Man accused of Darwin bottle shop murder expected to argue self-defence, court hears

image.altText: An image of a small carpark next to a Middle Arm boat ramp.

props.synopsis: The federal environment minister has approved the terms for a study into the potential environmental impacts of the proposed Middle Arm industrial precinct near Darwin — a project billed as key development for the NT, and that the federal senate is currently scrutinising.

title.children: Federal government approves terms for Middle Arm environmental impact study

image.altText: Operation Kudu 4

props.synopsis: Australian personnel who've been training Ukrainian military recruits will be welcomed home today as the government announces an expansion of the assistance mission.

title.children: Australia expands Ukraine military training mission, faces growing pressure to re-open embassy in Kyiv

image.altText: A landscape image of Jimmy Barnes wearing a black top. The background is out of focus but there is red, orange and blue light

props.synopsis: Jane Barnes announces her husband Jimmy is recovering from open heart surgery he needed after a bacterial infection spread to his heart.

title.children: Musician Jimmy Barnes 'made it through' open heart surgery

image.altText: Worker in high vis standing next to a tunnel boring machine.

props.synopsis: A 143-metre-long tunnel boring machine working on the massive Snowy Hydro 2.0 project is moving again, a year after getting stuck and causing a large sinkhole.

title.children: Snowy Hydro tunnel boring machine moving a year after getting stuck

image.altText: A man sitting in a hotel room wearing an off-white hoodie

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja says he will not wear shoes bearing the words "all lives are equal" during the Perth Test against Pakistan, but he says he will fight the ICC's ruling on the shoes.

title.children: 'My heart can't take it': Emotional Khawaja won't wear 'political' shoes, but will fight ICC ruling

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Angus Llewellyn is facing his second day of cross-examination by Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer, focusing on alleged contradictory statements Brittany Higgins made during her interview on The Project.

title.children: Producer for The Project questioned about 'inconsistencies' in Brittany Higgins's interview

image.altText: A close up of Imran Khan looking down and gesturing with his hands near a Pakistan flag.

props.synopsis: A Pakistani court indicts former prime minister Imran Khan on charges of leaking state secrets, a charge he denies.

title.children: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan indicted

image.altText: a red Tesla Model 3 sedan is charged at a Tesla dealership with the Tesla logo shown on the dealership building in the back

props.synopsis: The recall comes after a two-year investigation by US auto safety regulators into a series of crashes that happened while the Autopilot system was in use.

title.children: Tesla recalls more than 2 million vehicles across US to fix defective Autopilot system

image.altText: Man assaulting police officer on ground

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged over the alleged assault of a police officer in Parkwood. They have also been charged with weapons offences.

title.children: Bystanders film alleged bashing of female police officer on Gold Coast, pair charged

image.altText: Two paramedics in uniform stand before an ambulance vehicle. They both look serious.

props.synopsis: As the city is branded a "real-life version of Mad Max", two ambulances have been forced into evasive action, including one on an emergency call, raising concerns about the impact on crews and patients.

title.children: Townsville paramedics shaken as car thieves run ambulances off the road

image.altText: A modern-looking, dark-coloured court complex.

props.synopsis: Magistrate Michelle Ridley comes down hard on Kununurra police for their dealings with a boy who she said seemed to view car theft as a form of "common entertainment".

title.children: Magistrate acquits 10-year-old who tried to ram patrol car, slams police handling of case

image.altText: A couple smiling holding a baby.

props.synopsis: A young couple has appeared in court charged over the death of Adelaide doctor Michael Yung after they allegedly stole from a pharmacy.

title.children: Adelaide couple allegedly stole medical items before being arrested over death of doctor Michael Yung, court told

image.altText: A woman speaks into microphones, behind her a group of people stand solemnly

props.synopsis: The government has been facing mounting pressure to launch an inquiry following the deaths of six South Australians from alleged family and domestic violence in recent weeks.

title.children: 'It will save lives': South Australia to hold royal commission into domestic violence

image.altText: A kelpie on a farm in front of a truck.

props.synopsis: Many grain farmers in South Australia are celebrating an early harvest and planning how they will keep busy on what will be one of their earliest breaks at Christmas time.

title.children: SA grain growers go Christmas shopping and have family holidays after early harvest finish
